page.title: 02POPULATION AND POLITICS
page.content: The population of Kingsland is 650 and that of Eyton is 80. Over half the households belong to families who have lived here for over 50 years, some for 100 to 200 years and at least two families who have lived here since the 15th and 16th centuries. These, and many others, come from Herefordshire or Wales. Since 1969 there has been much new building in the area which has attracted people from other parts of the country, including several retired people. These have integrated well, thanks to the churches, school, Women's Institute and other groups. There is a Kingsland Conservative Association. Liberal Alliance and Labour supporters belong to wider-based associations.
